blog.name: triananero
blog.title: Dreamer&reader
blog.description: Yet another emotionally wrecked multifandom geek. Russian. Main fandoms for now: Haikyuu!! and figure skating. Also a bit fan of FMA, Noragami, Percy Jackson, Doctor Who. I translate and sometimes write fanfiction and some other fandom stuff. I usually take forever to answer, but I Always do! So feel free to write me, I'd gladly chat with you. Huge thanks to everyone who writes me about my fics, it is so so appreciated ;-;

tags: THIS IS AS EASY AS IT GETS OKAY
so no sitting out if you like his music
what have we gotten ourselves into again
title: Yuki Hayashi Birthday Project! 2018 edition
body:
In case you watch recent anime shows and you are somehow not aware, Yuki Hayashi is the brilliant composer behind the magnificent OSTs to many popular titles: Haikyuu!!, Boku no Hero Academia, Death Parade, One Piece Gold, Ballroom e Youkoso, Kiznaiver, Gundam Build Fighters, Karakuri Circus, Dive!!, Kaze ga Tsuyoku Fuiteiru —and that’s only the tip of the iceberg. Last year we already organized a project dedicated to his birthday, it was pretty grand lol and kind of complicated, we ended up having about a hundred participants from over 20 countries, and the composer was incredibly happy to receive such a gift (not even gonna lie, I’m pretty happy that we managed to make him cry x). So we decided to do something similar this year as well, only it’s going to be WAY LESS COMPLICATED and will literally take you UNDER 5 MINUTES!

Here’s what you need to do:

1) Go to this Google form and leave one (1) wish for the composer. 

That’s it. Literally.

We’ve procrastinated and now it’s finals hell, so we don’t have much time, but still couldn’t help doing at least something.

I know that many of us listen to his (and not only his) music for free for obvious reasons, and guys, first of all, I really recommend you to buy at least the CDs with your favorite music to directly support the creators, but if you can’t do it, such projects are literally the least we can do to thank them for the incredible work that they’re doing to make our experience of seeing our favorite characters come to life an unforgettable one. So please, do help us out, especially since it barely requires any effort at all from you! Just try and be creative about it :)

We’ll translate everything into Japanese, probably put it into some kind of an album and make sure it gets to the composer! I’ll let you know how it goes in January. 

His birthday is on December 31st, so please hurry up! We’ll probably wrap things up around 29th-30th.

You can also do something on your own if you wish! Hayashi-san really appreciates such things, and he absolutely loves it when people draw his dogs (especially Chloe-chan, we can see her on many OSTs covers), so don’t be shy! You can @ him on Twitter or Instagram. 

Thank you in advance for your help! Let’s show the composer that his music is really appreciated outside of Japan as well! ᕙ( * •̀ ᗜ •́ * )ᕗ

summary: Introducing new Demise!AU spin-off: The Quilk!AU
title: Introducing new Demise!AU spin-off: The Quilk!AU
body:
Alright so this is very random and will sound ridiculous (not anymore ridiculous than the rest of demise!au though i assure you) so lets get started. for the record, everytihng that is about to be written is a direct fault of the demise duscord server

The premise

In the second half of the original demise!au story, Izuku mixes DayQuil and NyQuil together to  see what happens and as a result has a manic episode of some sort followed by blacking out and having no memory of what happened, at the time describing it as ‘going through time’. The combo is officially dubbed as ForeverQuil, but is commonly reffered to as just Quil, the most basic quil combo.

The proposed idea by the discord server was: what if the strong reaction to Quil was a result of a quirk?

Now here me out. In the original BNHA we see several quirks that are set off by very specific conditions including CONSUMPTION OF SUBSTANCES such as Momo’s creation, Amajiki’s Manifest etc. And so I propose to you Izuku’s hidden quirk:

QUILVER - a set of reactions/powers triggered by consumption of specific chemical substances with the Quil acting as a catalyst.

It doesnt subvert canon so far, because how could a doctor detect this kind of power? You wouldn’t give a Quil combo to a child. Is it absolutely ridiculous? YES, YES IT IS AND IT GETS BETTER.

The idea is that sometime within the demise!au storyline Izuku’s doctor Shin notices his extreme reactions to the Quil and decides to test it, eventually coming up with the Quirk diagnosis and that’s where it all goes spectacularly to shit.

As mentioned before the Quil is only a base, meaning that if you mix it with other substances you can get different results-

Izuku’s List of Quil Mixes  (Don’t let Shin find this)

  • DayQuil (natural form of Quil no effect)
  • NyQuil (natural form of Quil, no effect)
  • ForeverQuil: mix of both dayQuil and nyQuil (Changes perception of time and space) THE ORIGINAL QUIL BASE
  • EternalQuil: The Quil and redbull (Flight)
  • InfinityQuil: The Quil and 20 shots of pure espresso (Speed)
  • NeverQuil: The Quil and Vodka (Solumunbust and allows for going through objects like vapour)
  • RagnaQuil: ForverQuil Eternal Quil and Infinity Quil all in one (transforms into the Jougumander, can bend atoms)
  • DragonQuil: Fireball whisky and Quil (Fire Breathing)
  • HauntedQuil: Bloody mary with a shot of Quil (makes him invisible, but leaves behind red residue)
  • ZuesQuil: Quil with a small electric charge in it (can short circuit any electronic device’s within 100m radius)
  • WyvernQuil: Quil mixed with Kerosene (Can breath out Liquid Napalm) Warning:DO NOT MIX WITH DRAGONQuil (if you do, you get UltraDragonQuil! Do not try this at home)
  • GodQuil: mixing protein powder for athletes with Quil (basically all might’s power with no downsides)
  • MidasQuil: the Quil mixed with the edible gold flakes for baking (the name speaks for itself, touch stuff it becomes gold)
  • BanditQuil: trash bandit’s wool and Quil (makes izuku into a sheep)
  • VenomQuil: Cyanide and Quil (Izuku can make poison, similarly to Ashido’s acid)
  • SickoQuil: Quil Mixed with Sprite Cranberry( Covers him in a mist of sprite cranberry){looks like a blood mist}[Induces uncontrollable fear]
  • HornyQuil: lube, viagra and Quil (makes people around him horny)
  • MaidQuil: Bleach and Quil (Makes a big wave that cleans everything out, leaving a clean white space)
  • CursedQuil: Izuku’s own blood and Quil (gives him access to different dimensions, that’s how he accidentally switches places with canon izuku in the swap!canon verse)
  • ChronosQuil: Perfect combo of NyQuil and DayQuil and liquid hydrogen (allows to manipulate time)
  • QuilQuil: ForeverQuil, ChronosQuil, NeverQuil and liquid nitrogen all mixed together (In izuku’s own words: ALL THE TIME, ALL THE TIME)
  • JesusQuil: ForeverQuil mixed with holy water (It speaks for itself)
  • BlankQuil: Quil mixed with Whiteout (Disintegration)
  • GayQuil: Quil mixed with marshmallows and lucky charms (makes everyone within 100m radium very gay eg: singing queen songs, be bad at driving, barf rainbows. Can also act as healing potion)
  • VoodooQuil: a person’s blood and hair mixed with quil (allows for manipulation of actions and feelings)

PlusUltraQuil: JUST FUCKING DUMP THEM ALL TOGETHER (ATOMIC SPLITTING) WARNING:ONLY USE AS A LAST RESORT atomic bomb that could make dinosaurs extinct again

Fun fact, Quil is a greek word for juice.

The current proposed name for Izuku with this quirk would be THE DRUGGED UP HERO APOLLO since he’s associated with healing and medicine.

His hero outift is like this old wizard from a fantasy game, with a belt full of quil bottles, his cape is essentially a longer version of his trashy coat from lost and found and he wears one of those hats with cup holders and long straws.

He can achieve pretty much any sort of power with the right combo of unholy substances, so that makes him the Quil Monoma.

I will be updating this list every now and then for some corrections and additional unholy combos that my server can think of.

It doesnt subvert canon so far, because how could a doctor detect this kind of power? You wouldn’t give a Quil combo to a child. Is it absolutely ridiculous? YES, YES IT IS AND IT GETS BETTER.

The idea is that sometime within the demise!au storyline Izuku’s doctor Shin notices his extreme reactions to the Quil and decides to test it, eventually coming up with the Quirk diagnosis and that’s where it all goes spectacularly to shit.

As mentioned before the Quil is only a base, meaning that if you mix it with other substances you can get different results-

Izuku’s List of Quil Mixes  (Don’t let Shin find this)

  • DayQuil (natural form of Quil no effect)
  • NyQuil (natural form of Quil, no effect)
  • ForeverQuil: mix of both dayQuil and nyQuil (Changes perception of time and space) THE ORIGINAL QUIL BASE
  • EternalQuil: The Quil and redbull (Flight)
  • InfinityQuil: The Quil and 20 shots of pure espresso (Speed)
  • NeverQuil: The Quil and Vodka (Solumunbust and allows for going through objects like vapour)
  • RagnaQuil: ForverQuil Eternal Quil and Infinity Quil all in one (transforms into the Jougumander, can bend atoms)
  • DragonQuil: Fireball whisky and Quil (Fire Breathing)
  • HauntedQuil: Bloody mary with a shot of Quil (makes him invisible, but leaves behind red residue)
  • ZuesQuil: Quil with a small electric charge in it (can short circuit any electronic device’s within 100m radius)
  • WyvernQuil: Quil mixed with Kerosene (Can breath out Liquid Napalm) Warning:DO NOT MIX WITH DRAGONQuil (if you do, you get UltraDragonQuil! Do not try this at home)
  • GodQuil: mixing protein powder for athletes with Quil (basically all might’s power with no downsides)
  • MidasQuil: the Quil mixed with the edible gold flakes for baking (the name speaks for itself, touch stuff it becomes gold)
  • BanditQuil: trash bandit’s wool and Quil (makes izuku into a sheep)
  • VenomQuil: Cyanide and Quil (Izuku can make poison, similarly to Ashido’s acid)
  • SickoQuil: Quil Mixed with Sprite Cranberry( Covers him in a mist of sprite cranberry){looks like a blood mist}[Induces uncontrollable fear]
  • HornyQuil: lube, viagra and Quil (makes people around him horny)
  • MaidQuil: Bleach and Quil (Makes a big wave that cleans everything out, leaving a clean white space)
  • CursedQuil: Izuku’s own blood and Quil (gives him access to different dimensions, that’s how he accidentally switches places with canon izuku in the swap!canon verse)
  • ChronosQuil: Perfect combo of NyQuil and DayQuil and liquid hydrogen (allows to manipulate time)
  • QuilQuil: ForeverQuil, ChronosQuil, NeverQuil and liquid nitrogen all mixed together (In izuku’s own words: ALL THE TIME, ALL THE TIME)
  • JesusQuil: ForeverQuil mixed with holy water (It speaks for itself)
  • BlankQuil: Quil mixed with Whiteout (Disintegration)
  • GayQuil: Quil mixed with marshmallows and lucky charms (makes everyone within 100m radium very gay eg: singing queen songs, be bad at driving, barf rainbows. Can also act as healing potion)
  • VoodooQuil: a person’s blood and hair mixed with quil (allows for manipulation of actions and feelings)

PlusUltraQuil: JUST FUCKING DUMP THEM ALL TOGETHER (ATOMIC SPLITTING) WARNING:ONLY USE AS A LAST RESORT atomic bomb that could make dinosaurs extinct again

Fun fact, Quil is a greek word for juice.

The current proposed name for Izuku with this quirk would be THE DRUGGED UP HERO APOLLO since he’s associated with healing and medicine.

His hero outift is like this old wizard from a fantasy game, with a belt full of quil bottles, his cape is essentially a longer version of his trashy coat from lost and found and he wears one of those hats with cup holders and long straws.

He can achieve pretty much any sort of power with the right combo of unholy substances, so that makes him the Quil Monoma.

I will be updating this list every now and then for some corrections and additional unholy combos that my server can think of.

summary: Tbh I was getting a bit agitated with your original review since you seemed to ignore the concept of quirk singularity so I’m...
question: Tbh I was getting a bit agitated with your original review since you seemed to ignore the concept of quirk singularity so I’m glad that you elaborated on another post. When the users were shown in the dream, I figured that OFA had mutated into a Avatar like state more than a sentient being. And tbh I highly doubt that Horikoshi just thought this up on whim, he set up quirk singularity for a reason. Seems like you’ve allowed others’ “theories” to clout your reviews which is a bit disappointing...
answer:
I’m not letting it clout my judgement so much as something I try to commentate on is fandom reaction. This may harken back to my days of reviewing FT, in which volitile fandom opinions really needed to be confronted.

Which is why I like to often comment on the reactions I see from people, and given this is a mystery I unfortunately need to discuss a theory or two because explanations to a mystery are worth analyzing.

I will acknowledge as of late my personal preferences about this series are showing more and more. But I do try to acknowledge regardless of how I feel I do still try to say at the end of last week that while I don’t agree with a decision of this raging one for all, it doesn’t make it a bad one. We just have to watch it.

Though I fully acknowledge that was a fault of mine was not talking about quirk singularities. I was honestly torn between putting it in the review or giving it a separate post. I opted for separate cause I felt I loaded up my current review. But in hind sight I should’ve at least put in like a plug about how I’ll discuss this later.

Now while I welcome all criticism of myself, I will say that I never accused Horikoshi of making this up, I stated that this was built up to. I however, do stand by saying I don’t agree with it and that it does feel like this a way to impede a character given how it seems impossible for him to go back to breaking his bones.

If what I make is disappointing as of late, I will try to improve. However, I still stand by the things I wrote even discussions or elaboration of fandom opinion.

summary: I have been thinking of starting a section, where I look into some unexplored characters, and analyze what little we know about...
body:
Exploring BNHA characters

I have been thinking of starting a section, where I look into some unexplored characters, and analyze what little we know about them, to reach a final conclusion, of what their backstories could be like. This is going to be my opinion, and from my point of view. So with that said, I wanted to start with my favourite: Fumikage Tokoyami.

We all know him. The short guy with the bird head, his quirk is Dark Shadow and he is one of the strongest students in his class. He is also silent, edgy, and he doesn’t talk much. But the question now, is: why is he so edgy? He is described as a “chuuni kid”, Generally a chuuni acts like a mature know-it-all and/or thinks they have special powers, no one else has. But why does he act like that? I mean, yes, Tokoyami is going through his teenage phase, but why does he talk the way he does? Why does he act so mature? I’ll try to answer those questions. Now, I’m sure everybody remembers this scene: 

Where Tokoyami loses control, and he tells Shouji and Deku that they will die if they don’t escape. This scene made us all, or at least most uf us, wonder, if Tokoyami has ever killed someone on accident. He could have simply told them, to leave him alone, or run to safety, but instead of that, he went as far as to tell them, that they would die. Now, we know that quirks usually manifest at the age of four. We don’t know, if that’s the case with Dark Shadow, but something we know, or at least we can infer, is that Dark Shadow wasn’t as strong when Tokoyami was little, as he is now. And something else, we can get out of all of this, is that, probably, that wasn’t the first time, Tokoyami lost control. Now the question that arises: In the probable case that he lost control in the past, what exactly happened? Perhaps he injured someone, perhaps he did not. Perhaps, the first time he lost control, Dark Shadow wasn’t as strong as he is now, and he didn’t cause any major injuries to anyone. Another thing I want to point out, is his room:

Yes, we have all seen his room in the “room contest”. As we can all see, his room is as edgy, and dark, as we would expect from him. But the really important thing here, is that, his room is full of stuff, he doesn’t actually need. Like his sword, the bat wings, or even his keychains.

He doesn’t really need them, and still, he has them just for the “aesthetic”. Like really, What normal 15-year-old child would need that? I have even noticed he has a huge comfortable chair in the manga version of his room, which is missing in the anime. After looking at his room, I reached a conclusion: Tokoyami comes from a wealthy family. Yes, perhaps, not as rich as Momo, Iida, or Shoto, but perhaps, Bakugou’s level of wealth. It’s apparent that his parents allow him to buy all this seemingly “unnecessary stuff”. But then another question pops out: if his parents are so kind as to allow their kid to get himself a fucking sword and keep it, then why isn’t he spoiled? You know, normally the kids who have permission to get whatever they want, would be spoiled, loud brats. (Of course, Momo and Iida are not like that, perhaps, because they received a special type of education when they were little). And Tokoyami is not. The other question is, which parent would actually allow their kid to have a sword, or be as edgy as Tokoyami. Let’s be honest, if any of us had a room like his, and talked the same way he does, then, we would constantly have our parents, telling us, to grow up of that phase. But apparently, Toko’s parents are not bothered at all, by their kids behaviour. Which means, either they are all edgy/goth, which I doubt, or… they are missing. The last thing I wanted to point out, is Tokoyami’s lack of emotion, whenever he is complimented, or he wins something. Just look at this:

He got third place, and he is not even trying to smile. Not even after a hug from All Might. Or here:

He looks surprised after Deku’s compliment. This means, that Tokoyami is clearly not used to compliments. He acts as if doing what he does, and trying to exceel at almost everything, (except for academics) is his duty. He doesn’t know the meaning of the word chill. Another interesting fact, is that during one of the BNHA drama cd’s, Bakugou and Tokoyami, have a conversation in the bus, on their way to the camp. Tokoyami asks Bakugou about Jeanist and his internship, and Bakugou asks him, if he is a normal 15 year old kid. Calling him out on his way of speech, and describing him as an “old man”. Tokoyami gets angry, and literally menaces to unleash Dark Shadow on him, even knowing that he’s at a disadvantage against Bakugou. There we saw his pride: he knows he is strong. And he is also interested and invested in Pro heroes, (not as much as,Deku). He even tried to surpass Hawks during his internship:

All this made me think that, perhaps, there’s someone, who pressures Tokoyami into being a top Pro Hero. So my conclusions are, or what I think his backstory could be like:

As a kid, he accidentally killed his mother, and his father horrified, gave him in adoption. After that, he was adopted by a caring and wealthy family, but eventually, his adoptive mother died for some reason, and that made his adoptive and gentle father, a lot more serious and strict, pressuring and forckng him into being a Top Hero at all costs. That’s the reason Tokoyami acts the way he does, and he is so interested in heroes, and acts so mature.

Well, that’s everything for now.

After looking at his room, I reached a conclusion: Tokoyami comes from a wealthy family. Yes, perhaps, not as rich as Momo, Iida, or Shoto, but perhaps, Bakugou’s level of wealth. It’s apparent that his parents allow him to buy all this seemingly “unnecessary stuff”. But then another question pops out: if his parents are so kind as to allow their kid to get himself a fucking sword and keep it, then why isn’t he spoiled? You know, normally the kids who have permission to get whatever they want, would be spoiled, loud brats. (Of course, Momo and Iida are not like that, perhaps, because they received a special type of education when they were little). And Tokoyami is not. The other question is, which parent would actually allow their kid to have a sword, or be as edgy as Tokoyami. Let’s be honest, if any of us had a room like his, and talked the same way he does, then, we would constantly have our parents, telling us, to grow up of that phase. But apparently, Toko’s parents are not bothered at all, by their kids behaviour. Which means, either they are all edgy/goth, which I doubt, or… they are missing. The last thing I wanted to point out, is Tokoyami’s lack of emotion, whenever he is complimented, or he wins something. Just look at this:

He got third place, and he is not even trying to smile. Not even after a hug from All Might. Or here:

He looks surprised after Deku’s compliment. This means, that Tokoyami is clearly not used to compliments. He acts as if doing what he does, and trying to exceel at almost everything, (except for academics) is his duty. He doesn’t know the meaning of the word chill. Another interesting fact, is that during one of the BNHA drama cd’s, Bakugou and Tokoyami, have a conversation in the bus, on their way to the camp. Tokoyami asks Bakugou about Jeanist and his internship, and Bakugou asks him, if he is a normal 15 year old kid. Calling him out on his way of speech, and describing him as an “old man”. Tokoyami gets angry, and literally menaces to unleash Dark Shadow on him, even knowing that he’s at a disadvantage against Bakugou. There we saw his pride: he knows he is strong. And he is also interested and invested in Pro heroes, (not as much as,Deku). He even tried to surpass Hawks during his internship:

All this made me think that, perhaps, there’s someone, who pressures Tokoyami into being a top Pro Hero. So my conclusions are, or what I think his backstory could be like:

As a kid, he accidentally killed his mother, and his father horrified, gave him in adoption. After that, he was adopted by a caring and wealthy family, but eventually, his adoptive mother died for some reason, and that made his adoptive and gentle father, a lot more serious and strict, pressuring and forckng him into being a Top Hero at all costs. That’s the reason Tokoyami acts the way he does, and he is so interested in heroes, and acts so mature.

Well, that’s everything for now.
trail.content:
Exploring BNHA characters

I have been thinking of starting a section, where I look into some unexplored characters, and analyze what little we know about them, to reach a final conclusion, of what their backstories could be like. This is going to be my opinion, and from my point of view. So with that said, I wanted to start with my favourite: Fumikage Tokoyami.

We all know him. The short guy with the bird head, his quirk is Dark Shadow and he is one of the strongest students in his class. He is also silent, edgy, and he doesn’t talk much. But the question now, is: why is he so edgy? He is described as a “chuuni kid”, Generally a chuuni acts like a mature know-it-all and/or thinks they have special powers, no one else has. But why does he act like that? I mean, yes, Tokoyami is going through his teenage phase, but why does he talk the way he does? Why does he act so mature? I’ll try to answer those questions. Now, I’m sure everybody remembers this scene: 

Where Tokoyami loses control, and he tells Shouji and Deku that they will die if they don’t escape. This scene made us all, or at least most uf us, wonder, if Tokoyami has ever killed someone on accident. He could have simply told them, to leave him alone, or run to safety, but instead of that, he went as far as to tell them, that they would die. Now, we know that quirks usually manifest at the age of four. We don’t know, if that’s the case with Dark Shadow, but something we know, or at least we can infer, is that Dark Shadow wasn’t as strong when Tokoyami was little, as he is now. And something else, we can get out of all of this, is that, probably, that wasn’t the first time, Tokoyami lost control. Now the question that arises: In the probable case that he lost control in the past, what exactly happened? Perhaps he injured someone, perhaps he did not. Perhaps, the first time he lost control, Dark Shadow wasn’t as strong as he is now, and he didn’t cause any major injuries to anyone. Another thing I want to point out, is his room:

Yes, we have all seen his room in the “room contest”. As we can all see, his room is as edgy, and dark, as we would expect from him. But the really important thing here, is that, his room is full of stuff, he doesn’t actually need. Like his sword, the bat wings, or even his keychains.

He doesn’t really need them, and still, he has them just for the “aesthetic”. Like really, What normal 15-year-old child would need that? I have even noticed he has a huge comfortable chair in the manga version of his room, which is missing in the anime. After looking at his room, I reached a conclusion: Tokoyami comes from a wealthy family. Yes, perhaps, not as rich as Momo, Iida, or Shoto, but perhaps, Bakugou’s level of wealth. It’s apparent that his parents allow him to buy all this seemingly “unnecessary stuff”. But then another question pops out: if his parents are so kind as to allow their kid to get himself a fucking sword and keep it, then why isn’t he spoiled? You know, normally the kids who have permission to get whatever they want, would be spoiled, loud brats. (Of course, Momo and Iida are not like that, perhaps, because they received a special type of education when they were little). And Tokoyami is not. The other question is, which parent would actually allow their kid to have a sword, or be as edgy as Tokoyami. Let’s be honest, if any of us had a room like his, and talked the same way he does, then, we would constantly have our parents, telling us, to grow up of that phase. But apparently, Toko’s parents are not bothered at all, by their kids behaviour. Which means, either they are all edgy/goth, which I doubt, or… they are missing. The last thing I wanted to point out, is Tokoyami’s lack of emotion, whenever he is complimented, or he wins something. Just look at this:

He got third place, and he is not even trying to smile. Not even after a hug from All Might. Or here:

He looks surprised after Deku’s compliment. This means, that Tokoyami is clearly not used to compliments. He acts as if doing what he does, and trying to exceel at almost everything, (except for academics) is his duty. He doesn’t know the meaning of the word chill. Another interesting fact, is that during one of the BNHA drama cd’s, Bakugou and Tokoyami, have a conversation in the bus, on their way to the camp. Tokoyami asks Bakugou about Jeanist and his internship, and Bakugou asks him, if he is a normal 15 year old kid. Calling him out on his way of speech, and describing him as an “old man”. Tokoyami gets angry, and literally menaces to unleash Dark Shadow on him, even knowing that he’s at a disadvantage against Bakugou. There we saw his pride: he knows he is strong. And he is also interested and invested in Pro heroes, (not as much as,Deku). He even tried to surpass Hawks during his internship:

All this made me think that, perhaps, there’s someone, who pressures Tokoyami into being a top Pro Hero. So my conclusions are, or what I think his backstory could be like:

As a kid, he accidentally killed his mother, and his father horrified, gave him in adoption. After that, he was adopted by a caring and wealthy family, but eventually, his adoptive mother died for some reason, and that made his adoptive and gentle father, a lot more serious and strict, pressuring and forckng him into being a Top Hero at all costs. That’s the reason Tokoyami acts the way he does, and he is so interested in heroes, and acts so mature.

Well, that’s everything for now.

body:
(BNHA SPOILERS ahead)

How I wish the Overhaul arc would have gone:

Dabi and Spinner return.

Spinner: We leave one time and come back to find that Magne’s dead and Mr. Compress is missing an arm?

Dabi: Because of this germaphobe reject?

Overhaul: What did you call me?

Dabi: Fuck off -shoots a spitball at him-

Overhaul: -Horrified-

summary:
With the latest chapters, there's something that's been on my mind... 
Based on what we're seeing, Midoriya's arm is pretty much...
body:
With the latest chapters, there’s something that’s been on my mind…

Based on what we’re seeing, Midoriya’s arm is pretty much fucked. He was crying out in pain, saying it hurts, there’s just no way it’s not broken in some aspect.

So my thought is, is it possible he could lose most use of that arm?
